Worth the Walk. It is a long but very scenic walk to the castle district. You get an amazing view of Lesser Town, the river, Charles Bridge and Old Town. At night this area is lit up and looks absolutely beautiful on top of the hill.
terracotta rooves everywhere. What a magical place Prague is. Never get tired of looking at all the amazing history this city has to offer.
Nice area with a lot to see. The castle area is great for sightseeing. A lot of things to see and a lot of nice cafes and restaurants.

For the history-lover. It's a great place for seeing a piece of the history of Prague. There's a few different buildings to go into if you buy a ticket, like the old castle, the cathedral, St George's Basilica and more.

Don't Miss The Castle District. We went in a tour car but you can walk up the hill. Gorgeous breathtaking views of the city. There are several old abbeys and mansions. Many restaurants. And the entrance to the Castle and the Cathedral. Don't miss the views!

Great period architecture. On a good day it is really worth having a walk around the castle district. Lots of well preserved old buildings, great views; or if you want, just a nice place to sit with a pint or a coffee.
very hip and trendy. good place to walk slowly and enjoy the small shops , don't forget to pay vigil to Franz Kafka on your way to the bridges

Discover Prague Castle District walking tour. I took the 2pm walking tour through Prague's Castle District with the lovely Dora from Croatia. Dora was extremely informative, and very patient and patient and funny! Dora made sure everybody had a good time, while at the same shared her extensive knowledge of the Castle Districts political history, general history and architecture, along with contemporary information that you won't find in travel books! She was also very generous with her knowledge of other European cities, with many people on the tour going to other places, Dora had good recommendations for them also. The tour was well worth every last krona and I would do it again if I had time!

Worth the climb for the view. We climbed up the steps of the castle district and the views were beautiful. Here is an all in one cathedral, palace, and castle. Price to enter is reasonable. Changing of the guards happens at 12 noon and is a must.. Site is very crowded and a haven for pickpockets.

Already crowded- watch your wallet. Spectacular views, amazing history - and elbow to elbow people. We were with a guide, so saw all the high points, but if left to our own devices, might have bailed.

The Castle dominates the City Skyline. A visit to the Castle is a must, the structure is just beautiful and it dominates the skyline as you move around the city. The cathedral is stunning as are the surrounding structures. As you move from the Castle out into the neighborhood there are some great buildings and the cobblestone streets leading to the Charles Bridge are wonderful. A great walk down the hill to the bridge and back into the city

Stunning city views. We climbed up the steps to the castle district and the views over the City were amazing. Red roofs, and green domed churches. There is so much to see and do once you are at the top. The cathedral, palace and castle, and the price is very good too to enter all these amazing places. If you are on a tight budget you can just stroll around all the grounds, the main body of the cathedral too for free. Don't miss the changing of the guards at 12 noon.
Historic area. It is a lovely walk up to this historic area of the city and the views over the rest of the city are truly stunning and there is a castle and a cathedral to visit
Wonderful. Around every corner from the Palace back down to the River always something different to see. Lovely bars and restaurants all selling good food at fair prices
Castle District. It is a nice uphill walk and many shops and restaurants. Once you are on the top then there is a nice view of Prague.

Seen from the outside. We were strolling around inside the walls of the castle and around St. Vitus Cathedral. It's a magnificent building even just seen from the outside.When leaving the castle go down on the right side of the castle through the old and very well renovated part of the town.Here you have lots of small bars and restaurents, and your pick is just a matter of you moode, as there something for everybody.
Historic area. The castle precincts are historic and beautiful with a lot of very old architecture. Many buildings to visit showing how life was in earlier centuries.

Very Disappointing Service!!. The day we travelled to the Castle District, everything was closed for the day, yet there was no mention of this fact on their website. We were told to come back 3 days later??!! We went back 2 days later, it was raining, cold, and the place was packed with tour groups. We ended up standing in a lineup outside (in rain) because they only had 2 people processing tickets. Once we paid for 3 adults, it was then (and only then) that they told us the the lineups were so long we would never get into any of the sites. They were right....there were hundreds and hundreds of people in the line. What is rather annoying is that this information was not provided prior to our paying the fee. We ended up leaving............so disappointed with the way this is handled!!

Beautiful courtyard, grounds & views. A wonderful area of the city w/ great views of the rest of Prague. Beautiful walks through gardens and up and down wide, stone stairways and cobbled walkways. Nerudova street is lovely. We stayed on Nerudova at The Hotel Golden Wheel. Great, friendly, well-appointed small hotel in a fantastic location. The Castle District & Hotel Golden Wheel are both romantic locations. I was just there celebrating my wife & my 33rd wedding anniversary.... No better location could exist for our celebration!

Interesting but mainly closed. Unfortunately when I visited a number of the sights, including the castle itself was closed due to televising of an imminent festival. From what I could see it would be worth a return visit

Lovely historical area to walk around .. We took a viator walking tour which was over five hrs . Most of the time was in the .castle district lovely historic buildings , the gardens are lovely, then on to the Charles bridge nice view of the Vltava River. The negative with this tour much time was waisted translating from English to Spanish for only two Mexican tourists. I would recommend asking if you speak English for an English only tour.
Various Neighborhoods. We strolled through the Castle District on the way back from the castle, onward to Mala Strana area. Cute neighborhoods and many restaurants.

Beautiful!. The castle district of Prague is beautiful! Very oldly worldly! Lovely walk over the Charles bridge to get it. Lots of side streets to explore with restaurants and bars! Lovely place to walk around in the day and evening!
Awesome!. amazing, romantic and scenic places all around. nice walking if it's not too cold.had a great time.
Weekend in Prague. Wonderful place, beautiful scenery everywhere. Decided to go on foot to take in as much as possible, lovely café's and restaurants. Can't wait to return.

Take a Metro. The public Metro system is good, so we took the public metro to the castle and spent our own time, rather than paying for a tour. The district is large, not only is there the castle, but there are gardens nearby. It is NOT in the center of Prague, so make sure you know the transit routes, or will have a LONG walk.

Much grander than expected. Plan to get there early as some places close about 4pm. If we were to do over, might hire a driver or tour operator to take us around. It is amazing and worth the time to see everything. Views of Prague are spectacular.

Nice stroll in the afternoon. Nice stroll in the small streets in the afternoon though very crowded. You should visit the Kampa Island, the Venice of Prague, where they filmed both Mission:Impossible and The Bourne Identity.

Amazing architecture and history. The castle district was the highlight of our visit. The grandeur and history is remarkable, the shops in the area are a plus since there were souvenirs to satisfy all interests at reasonable prices.

Best Views. The castle is lovely of course, but the views from there are absolutely fantastic. We were so fortunate to be able to see the changing of the guard right in front of our noses (for once in the right place at the right time). Shopped the little stores around until time to get back on the bus.
great place. great place to walk around. lots of historic buildings, restaurants, and shops. It is very hilly, so need to make sure to wear comfortable shoes.

Stroll through history. The castle district - always take the transit bus to the top - go past the middle/most popular stop if you have the time - and a walk down through the various structures is a true lesson in architecture and history. If you can go early in the day, even better. The quiet and the views - closeup and across to the city - are spectacular.

Amazing viewpoint. The castle district rests on a hill overlooking the old part of Prague and is a bit of a climb if you decide to walk. There is an easy city train that goes there for a cheap price. Be ready to spend time , most of a day. We were there for the changing of the guard at noon. Be sure to go to the archers homes and artisan shops that are inside the walls. The grounds and gardens are well kept and attractive. Be sure to go inside the cathedral and check out the concert times in the evenings.
Fairytale castle. This castle is so big, it's actually like a village or a small town making up the castle. Today it's touristy, but for a good reason.

Castle area. Our hotel was here which was great. During the day the area was buzzing with visitors but in the evening we had peace and quiet and found a great restaurant too. Plenty to see and do in the Lesser Town

Just a wonderful place to visit and the Castle is amazing.. I don't begin to proclaim myself to be an expert on Castles, we visited quite a few in Germany, Hungary, Czech and Poland. This was one of the most unique and beautiful castle's. The food in the Czech Republic (try the duck) was only surpassed by the Pilsner Urquell beer, which I have bought since returning to the states.
Beautiful district. Beautiful district, you absolutely must take a walk here! It is a good walk, so you have o be physically prepared!

do it by night. at 11 p.m,when all the tourists are drinking beer and the locals in their houses,it is nice to walk up the stairs,especially if this is your first night in prague.to feel it as it is.with no people,no food stalls and no noise.
Beautiful Historical town. Worth walking the streets, we walk down the streets from Prague castle. Beautiful cobblestones roads, lot of shops, restaurants, cafes, taverns etc.

extremely crowded but dont miss. We hiked up the hill to the Castle District as the crowds for the funicular were horrible by 10 a.m. on a Saturday. The walk was less intimidating than I expected but challenging nevertheless. Can only be done with good walking shoes and would be tough it was very hot. It is a long climb and fairly steep in some places although we saw many older people (like ourselves) and young children too. We stopped for water at the restaurant halfway up, nice views, pleasant although staff a bit surly. At the top there are plenty of things to see and do including a mini-Eiffel tower. Gorgeous parks and plantings so nice for a picnic lunch and people watching. Lots of restaurants there too. We found that visiting the many, many castles in the castle complex was exhausting and confusing as some are well marked but others not. I suppose there is a special map you can get to help with navigating the maze of buildings, lanes and squares. All of the architecture is beautifully restored and maintained and is an absolute treasure trove of architectural styles and details for the art lover.If you are going for the architecture and the castle specifically I would recommend a cab up there and maybe a walk down as I felt too weary to take it all in. We did not do the actual castle tour as the crowds were epic. It is the 700th anniversary celebration this year for King Charles and the Czech Crown Jewels were on display which is very rare, so I think tours were there for that especially, too. There are many small cafes and taverns all over the Castle complex and well sign posted WCs everywhere so you don't need to worry about going thirsty or hungry. If you like breathtaking panoramic views and Royal splendor, this experience is not to be missed. I don't care much for either but I am glad that I did see it. Having more information about the climb and the tours would have made it more enjoyable plus I do not like crowds so that was a downer for me personally.
Stunning. Very beautiful. On the walk up and down. Coming down we took the long scenic through the town to try to find the house signs. Cute worth the walk.

Teeming Castle district. I absolutely enjoyed the Castle District. Brimming with hundreds of unique shops lining the streets. The aroma of food clings in the air making a fantastic mixture with the inspirational sights. The massive castle complex is omnipresent throughout your journey up the many streets and alleyways. A climb that crescendos with the climax being the amazing castle. The castle district gave me a truly unique experience. Honestly a trip in Prague is not complete without a visit to the Castle District.
Visiting the Castle District. To say it is a beautiful place is to belittle it. It is supremely post-card pretty. And the landscape of the place is stunning.

Prague Castle was Amazing. Well worth half a day to visit the castle and vicinity. The castle has a website where tours are explained. St Vitus Cathedral is behind and very beautiful, and the plaza in front of the Castle was very interesting. There were food and tourist stalls nearby.

Very busy but worthwhile. Take tram 22 from the city and alight at Prazsky Hrad. No Disney style castle or battlements but still a major seat of Government with seriously heavily armed military guards in much evidence to complement the wholly ceremonial Gate Guards. (It is a major 21st century irony and so appropriately Kafkaesque that the military should wear camouflage battledress topped with a Hi-Vis vest!!)St Vitus cathedral is of breathtaking gothic stature and beauty. The royal gardens are a delightful (and downhill) stroll. Move away from the crowds eastwards towards the giant metronome that faces down Republiky then cross the extensive parkland northwards to pick up a return tram outside the football arena that hosts Sparta Prague's home games.

Nice area. This is the area on the west side of the Charles Bridge that includes the castle. I prefer NOT to take the Tram but to walk up myself. Lots of shops and good people watching. Very busy, with large crowds. Go early in the day (castle opens at 9am) to avoid most of the people.
Lots to see, plus stunning views!. Watched the changing of the guard, then walked round the cathedral. Castle queues were too long, but overall an enchanting experience.

PERFECT - AND TAKE THE TRAM. Such an amazing place to be in - turn in any direction and there is a beautiful building, palace, embassy, stunning panorama. From Strahov Abbey at the top (do take the tram No 22 from the bridge to Pohorelec, its a pretty trip up steep winding roads and trams are wonderful) you can then walk down visiting all the sites and monuments and gardens on the way. Have a good day.

Poor. Too many venues closed, too large crowds. Miserable experience. Take a tour or you will get little out of the visit. Palaces closed, teeming crowds with rowdy teens make for a poor experience. You really need a guide to maneuver effectively. At least the tram is easy to use to come and go

Greate place for a stroll and sightseeing. Took an afternoon walking around the streets looking through the little shops (both tourist, arts, craft, and food). Full of history that can transport you back in time. Quite hilly so be prepared, better to catch the tram up to the castle and then walk down hill. We were there just coming out of winter so the gardens on the hill were not in flower but would be impressive when they are. \Can take a couple of hours to walk directly back from the castle to town.
love the architecture. must see while in prague. do hire a guide to make it worthwhile. Great view from up there and amazing stories !

Great grand area but very crowded . A very great area as it's said to be the worlds greatest castle. A lot to be seen and experienced but prepare for queuing. Make sure you have plenty of time. The where queues for everything and some were quite long, this was in a supposed low season 3 April, I don't dare to think how it's like in summer and high season.

Visiting prague castle and grounds. You can enter gardens for free and it takes time to visit all the sites, depending if you choose to purchase longer or shorter sightseeing route. Audios tend to be lengthy so make sure you time out well on other activities...If you don't want to purchase tix, you can always, besides gardens, visit St. Vitus cathedral and watch change of guards inside castle grounds...
One of the best places anywhere. Great photo ops everywhere. Tons of history packed into small area. Rick Steve;s has a great walking tour of the district.
Wonderful views. This is a very interesting area with plenty to see and to do.The views are splendid. The only downside are the cobbles which are very slippery in when wet.

Walk through history (downhill) - pay attention to architecture. Best way to enjoy on your own - take tram 22 to Pohorelec and walk downhill. If you have more time, than look left for Novy Svet (New world) quiet beautiful place which served as backdrop for Amadeus film. if in hurry, just walk through The Castle and enjoy many views of magnificent red roofs.
Cool area. The whole area around the castle is interesting and I recommend exploring it by foot. There are many interesting buildings and gardens all around.

Must visit, absolutely beautiful.. Many cute shops, such as the Shakespeare & sons, and many things to see, such as the change of guards, the Prague castle, and more. Lovely view of Prague from most parts. Definitely recommended.

Beautiful Area of Prague. It is a very beautiful area of Prague and I recommend walking around it. Great views of the city and it is not difficult to get to. Has great architecture and very nice buildings.
A lovely place to wonder around. There's loads to see and is beautiful. A great place to wonder around. Loads of restaurants and bars. There are concerts and live music here.
Beautiful. Beautiful castle and area, a lot bigger than it looks from the outside, can be very busy so best to go early

Beautiful, fascinating place.... To everyone, unfortunately.. So much to see and do in and around the castle. History & romantic locations lie around every corner. Mozart, & Casanova walked these very streets... The view from the castle across the old city are beautiful and impressive. Beautiful churches, cathedrals and synagogues abound. Local and international food of all price ranges is everywhere. Walking around the area is simply magical........ But. Tourists are everywhere, all the time. Hawkers, guided tour parties, Segway hire groups, stupid fake vintage cars, tour buses.... The place is heaving, pretty much 20 hours a day. It's still a great place to visit and sightsee, but it's really, really crowded, any time of day or year. Still highly recommended, though.

Must do in Prague. So much to see walking the cobblestone streets and all of the well preserved 15th, 16th, 17th century buildings. You can spend many days walking the street of Prague and not see all of the little side streets with hidden shops and restaurants. I have been to Prague 5 times in the last 18 years and it never gets old.

Just get lost. Literally, this is a perfect place to get lost in (although this is impossible nowadays). Just walking through the neighborhood (as you would in all of Prague) one could get glimpses of wonderful little shops and places where to get a bite.It is just nice to visit by day and maybe even more by night, just watch yourself as you cross the streets, drivers are a litlle bit bullies.We just chose a place and ate there and it was good and relatively cheap. Really, just get lost and enjoy.
Castles!!'. My husband and I travel to visit castles in Prague has the best clean , very reasonably priced , interesting , dynamic gorgeous!Prague has it all, you have to go it's a must!
A very nice walking place. . Remember to ware good shoes with low heals as most of Prague has Cobble stone streets. It can be very hilly also. Do take your time and enjoy the shops.

A great walk. A fun and interesting afternoon can be spent on a sunny day wandering around and seeing various parts of the castle community. We bought the partial tour ticket as we were seeing the Lobkowicz Palace as well. It was enough.
Stunning castle. Great archetecture , stunning views from the top, , well worth buying tickets to gain access to ticketed areas as you can see the stunning stain glass windows throughout
very good. Beautiful castle interesting if you like to find out about prague history nice to just stroll about.. on a summer day.

Take a day or two to explore. Its claimed to be the largest castle in the world, more like a fortified palace than a castle, it is certainly extensive, churches, museums and of course the old palace, everything is signed in English as well as Czech, so it is essay to find your way around. Start early to avoid the crowds and your ticket lasts for 72 hours, so you don't have to do it all in one go.
Spotless!!!. First visit to Prague, hopefully not our last! Went to the castle district and admired the wonderful architecture, unfortunately didn't have enough time to visit the castle

Impressive. We had a Prague card, what they don't tell you is that you need to use the card to get tickets. Easy but could be irritating if the queues are long. Some of the guards have interesting approaches, they are very obvious in their supervision and many appeared resentful of our presence.Great place though!

Wonderful place to visit.. We went twice to this castle district to visit the castle itself and then the Loretanske Namesti to stroll the very old medieval streets...glad we didn't miss out on this location..definitely worth a visit !!!

Prague Castle. Lots of little shops to see along the way, the walk to the Prague Castle is in one way to see parts of the city. Don't forget to visit the little coffee shop along the way and enjoy freshly baked pastries.

Hradcany. Beautiful part of Prague, visit Prague Castle, Mala Strana, Cathedral of Saint. Vit. Kralovske Schody.There is many restaurant but I recommend you visit something small, not in turistic places.

Long steep walk to get there ..... Long steep walk to get there .... but plenty to see on the way, loads of shops, myriads of side streets. Great views from the castle walls ... castle itself is not that interesting, more like an old town hall ... but the church in the centre is pretty magnificent. Huge stained glass windows. Worth the walk - as long as it's not raining.

Nice area. I guess you walk through here in order to reach the castle itself, but other than seeing the castle and St. Vitus, there's not much else to do in the castle district. There are a few parks, the most notable of which is Letna, which you definitely should visit.

Beautiful day!. We attended early April but we're very fortunate with the weather. Beautiful buildings with lots of history attached. Great Street musicians added to the enchantment. Views were amazing.

Stunning Prague. I don't have anything negative to say about Prague, it's magnificent. I have been visiting since 2001 and have witnessed it's transformation from post communist shabby chic to a cosmopolitan city. There are so many areas to explore in the city and the castle area is very picturesque. We took a bus tour from the square but you could easily get there by tram. I cannot wait to go back!
So much history. This castle is the biggest in the world, a lot of historic and lovely views. A bit of a walk down though but definitely worth going and seeing.
Good shopping. Aside of the Castle itself there is good shopping in the district around the Castle. Don't just go for the shopping though, see the Castle as well.

Large in scope and very beautiful.. A highlight of our trip, from Saint Vitus, to the old living quarters, even the prison. The garden is a must walk through, our only regret was we didn't pack a bottle of wine and some cheese and bread for a picnic.
Castle and so much more. This area is historical, beautiful and charming. You can walk around for hours enjoying the area. I highly recommend spending a few hours here.
Beautiful area. I loved this area, which was clean & easy to walk around. Beautiful architecture, buildings & views with lots to see. A photographers dream.

historic. Walking to the castle is a nice exercise and the actual castle is like walking back in time. The grounds are grande and the history is interesting. The view from the top of the castle is spectacular.
Impressive. great walking opportunity ( just wear good comfortable shoes) as the paving is very uneven but great views and lovely architecture with history
Worth a visit. great views of the city make sure you go in it is free to walk around unless you want to see inside the buildings, the come back out and walk further up the hill to see more
Mala Strana. Lovely area to stay if you want to avoid the crowds and adult attractions in other areas of Prague. It does get busier heading up the hill to the Castle but easy to manage that aspect.
Worth exploring. Take your time here. Spend a few hours and walk around. There are great views over Prague and great places to stop for a beer. Something for everyone :-)
Gorgeous . Gorgeous district with great views of the whole city. We were very lucky and went on a sunny clear day so we could see everything.
Quite a view. The view from the top is very nice, one can spend a lot of time just enjoying the scenery, either by walking or drinking a coffee.

Boat trip. We took a boat trip on the river.they gave us free beer and ice cream the trip was really relaxing. And the crew was friendly.. the tour telling us all the history about the castle. And how the buildings want under water, a must to do.... thanks keith from uk

A must see.. This area has so much to offer but you can just wander and just enjoy the fine buildings. It is not so much a castle but more of a seat of government,palace and fine churches. It can be very busy with tour groups but we still found quiet places to sit.

Beautiful views, much to see and do. Although the walk up to the castle is long and steep, along the way are wonderful sights of Prague, the river, bridges and cityscape. It is fun to imagine what the castle and environs looked like hundreds of years ago before tourists, obviously the wealth amassed to build these immense castles and churches must have been hard to believe, but the result is lots of beautiful and historic sites to see.

Icon of Prague. One of the most beautiful areas in Prague with magnificent romantic view. When you want a touch of nature in Prague, definitely walk through Jeleni Prikop and also visit parts like Loreta and its nearby streets to see the hidden treasure of Prague.
Charming Distric. It's Prague. It's beautiful, it's charming, the people are friendly, and the prices are pretty cheap for Europe. What else do you need?

Nice area . The district was very nice. The higher you go the better the view. They had a nice little Christmas market in front of the castle. We ate at the restaurant that was there in the old days for the knights
Crowded. Too many people in the castle and all the district is too commercialised that the old and romantic atomsphere is destroyed.

Beautiful, Quiet, A must. Came to the Castle District on a walking tour of the Castle. And stayed afterwards, Simply a must see for Prague. Beautiful historic buildings, far less people than round the old town square, and so easier to enjoy. Add in the huge collection of lovely restaurants in the district, and no visit to Prague would be the same without it

Lovely Area and Magnificent Castle. You can easily spend an entire day in the castle grounds visiting lots of museums and churches. The combined ticket is sold in the office oposite the main entrance of St. Vitus cathedral. View of Mala Strana and Old town is amazing. Do not miss to see the entire area around the castle with fantastic palaces and walk to Loreta or Strahov Monastery
Amazing city. Beautiful buildings and architecture. Plenty of trams to hop on & off. Shops bars etc.. wonderful city

Hours of Viewing. You could spend most of your day here, we certainly did. You would need to buy a ticket covering all the sections of the Palace/Castle area but it is worth it. Good chance to see what Prague has to offer plus trying some local cuisine.

Beautiful Scenery. Quite a steep walk up to the castle district.. 208 steps and it was quite hard going.. but so worth it when you are at the top! Lovely views from the top and some beautiful buildings.
A great location to stroll around with wonderful views. Prague Castle is perched on top of a hill on the east bank of the river in a great location. Just stroll around and take in the wonderful views

Good day out. Good to go to amazing views of the city next to the castle. Cant go in the castle but if you go through to say restaurant you see the cathedral and other structures. Castle itself is up a hill so take in to account no public transport goes to it. Its walking. Worth a visit for the view

A unique place in the heart of Prague. One of the most beautiful castles we've seen so far (and I've seen many). The entire complex is full of museums and churches, and required about a day or two to see everything. Do not miss the walk to the top of the church, from there you can see the whole city and the view is unique.
Downtown Prague. We loved downtown Prague especially the Castle District. The buildings are amazing and the fact that they go back to 1100 or so, is mind-boggling. Don't miss this area.

Wear your walking shoes!. This area is really really spread out. You can walk for miles in this area. It is all cobblestone streets, so wear comfort shoes! At the entry there are pay toilets--have change.

Interesting. Lots to see around the Castle area although we couldn't find the Monastery easily. None of the spring flowers were out when we visited but the gardens would be worth walking through when they are. A peaceful area.
Great area. This is a great area to visit and would defo have a good camera as the sites are amazing in the night day anytime.
A great place to wonder. A great place to amble round the little road and side streets as you head up to the castle, beautiful buildings along the way to look at
A must do in Prague. It does get very busy, so try and time your visit to early morning or late afternoon. There's a lot of steps to reach it, so use the tram if you're not mobile

A journey back in time!. I had no time to search and arrange for a guided tour of the castle district so i went on my own. There were too many wonderful things to see and i'm absolutely sure i wasn't able to cover everything. In any case, my visit started perfectly as i managed to catch the changing of the guard in the Hradcanske square, in front of the old Royal Palace. From there i spent quite some time at the St. Vitus Cathedral, admiring it from every possible angle and taking lots of pictures (you can't blame it - it's fantastic!). Probably one of the things that i enjoyed the most was the Golden Lane - a narrow street full of tiny, colorful old houses. I would have never imagined such a place could still exist right next to a grand monument like the cathedral. These houses belonged to the city's artisans long ago and now they were turned into museums. I enjoyed one that was filled with pieces of armor & weapons but also houses of artists and writers (including one where Kafka stayed for a while).Later on, i went to see Daliborka tower which was actually a prison back in the day. All of this lasted for a few hours so i ended my tour at a nearby Panorama Coffe place, to chill out a bit and enjoy a good view of the city.

Lots to see, get tickets before entering St Vitus to avoid squish. This is the old section outside the really old central city part of Prague. It is interesting in itself, although a fair walk from the old centre. There are lots of things to see from tiny little houses, to the St Vitus cathedral and some castle rooms. Easy to spend half a day here. Handy that they sell mulled wine in winter, although not the cheapest ever. Tickets are sold opposite St Vitus for a number of sites and it is worth getting them to see the cathedral properly.
Wonderful afternoon . We spent a lovely afternoon around the castle. Eating various local food. Drinking beer. Amazing views. Get the tram up there though! No 22

Fabulous. This part of the city is just stunning! I can't stress enough how beautiful this city is. A walk round here is a must, and just wait till you see the views! There are plenty of nice restaurants, pubs, bars, and attractions here.
Walking around. Lots of different attractions, museums, churches, so everyone will find something interesting for himself. Restaurants and bars are around.
A beautiful view. We spent almost a full day walking the Charles Bridge over to Prague Castle. It was very beautiful to see the view from the Charles Bridge and then to see it up close.

The coolest part of Prague. It takes a bit of effort to get up there, but totally worth it. The complex is huge and if you decide to visit some of the museums or other attractions, it could easily take a whole day.
Bustling. All around the lower approach to the castle are winding streets with grand building. Lots of shops and places to stop and browse or get a bit to eat and drink.

weekend visit. The best place to see the entire city from. Its a steep climb but one which rewards the effort. Wedding couples come here to have their photos taken and open park space surrounding it all give a feeling of open space in an otherwise crowded tourist attraction
Too Good . This is the best area I found in Prague and try to stay in any hotel in this area, it's really superb staying in this area...
Great visit . The Castle district transports you to the XVI century. You can visit the old palace, the cathedral, the golden lane,... Takes almost a day the whole visit, but it is completely worth

a must see!. A nice area to wander - we walked almost the entire district. It was so interesting to see the unique and beautiful houses and business. We passed by a park and playground and climbed multiple stairs where the views were incredible! Had a delightful afternoon exploring this area!

Lovely old buildings. The castle areas are very beautifully kept. We did not see the changing of the guard as we were at the opposite end. There is a nice cafe down toward the Golden lane area. The old archbishops is in very good condition.

To walk through the Castle district is a must.. If using the no 22 tram to get up to the Castle if thinking of using the uppermost stop do go two stops further. this wayyou can walk back through the Castle district on you way down to the main Castle gates (gards change her on the hour) Lots of places to stop en-rout for coffee. One on the right hand sid when to face the main gates that have a wonderful terrace you can sit on.
Good views,. Nice area, the highlight is defiantly the church, not much of renaissance era castle but still cool. doesn't really seem like a castle.
Castle District. Crossing the Charles Bridge you get thrown back even further in time and get the feeling you are in old Prague. many interesting shops and restaurants and of course the castle.

Well worth crossing the river. In contrast to Old Town this area doesn't appear to have so many visitors, so if you want to get way from the crowds take a walk over the Charles Bridge and explore the area. There are many "palaces" now used by different embassies as well as small shops to browse through. If you want to visit the castle be aware it's a steep climb up to the complex, take a number 22 tram up if you're not sure of your condition.

Give it a whole day to explore.. This is such a beautiful part of Prague, with so much to see. Inside the castle walls it essentially a town in itself, with everything from the sublime (the cathedral) to the ridiculous (the barbie exhibition!).Within the castle walls can be fairly busy and crowded, but there are plenty of parts to wander for a bit of peace and quiet, and find a nice cafe to chill out.If you are going to go it alone, I would recommend walking up to the castle district over Charles Bridge, as it's the best way to see the many sites along the way. The walking tour is also especially good, which involves a tram to the top and a walk back down, and gives you a good overall history of the castle and surrounding area.

One the quiet side of town, but with rich history. Hadn't intended to visit this side of town, but got taken their on a walking tour and loved it. Warm people, fewer crowdes, especially stag party men. Enjoyed wandering the quieter streets contemplating the history. Much to see in central, but on your second or third day, this is a definite visit along with the castle and St. Vitis Cathedral.

Love the golden village . The whole district took me 2 days to look into (quite in depth if you are interested to their history) The little Golden village is somewhere you can feel the life of the people living there at that time. Of course Kafka's house is there :)

Full day/half day required!. Lots to see in the castle area.....easy to walk there from old town but it is on an incline so disabled or those who struggle to walk would be better to get a taxi there. The castle 'grounds' are relatively flat. Buy a ticket to get into all the fee paying attractions as it works out cheaper.
Breathtaking views . Worth the local walk up for the scenic views of the city. Lovely area to visit. Lots to see & lots of tourist groups too.

Very Pretty. Although you do have to haul yourself up a pretty big hill, it is a castle after all, the castle district offers stunning views of the city, and the streets can be imagined as they were hundreds of years ago. Of course the highlight is St. Vitus Cathedral, as well as the castle itself. Unfortunately the sun did not cooperate with us this day, as I'm sure it would have been even prettier.
Walk. When we left Prague Castle we walked through the Castle district to Charles Bridge and there are many little streets to explore with beautiful little buildings to photograph

Must visit. First time I was in Prague, I stupidly didn't spend a lot of time in the Castle District and didn't actually visit the castle. I am glad I didn't make the same mistake again. It's a bit of a walk from Old Town Square up to the Castle but I would say it's worth it. If you are tired take a taxi back. Beautiful view of the Old Town when you get up there, and the St. Vitus Cathedral and Castle are stunning.

Great day out - but a lot of walking. Lots to do in the castle area but takes a lot of time to see everything. Worth trying to see as much as possible - but not the cheapest of attractions.You need to make sure you show the right ticket at each part of the attraction as it is marked on a map at the back but the lady on the sales desk told us it all wrong! Also there are still some things that cost extra even when you've bought the top price tickets. There are several areas where backpacks and cameras are not allowed.

Prepare to walk walk walk. A huuuge complex of houses, museums, old buildings, and beautiful architecture, it's one way to immerse yourself in modern yet medieval times. I explored only like half of it because I didn't research enough to start my way through the easy path, but I totally loved it.If you are physically fit, climbing up the New Castle Stairs near Malostranska MRT will reward you a magnificent view of red-roofed pretty buildings (likely of the castle district) from waaay up. I believe you cannot just explore everything in one day, especially if some places are closed in one season and you happen to go in the season where it is closed.According to the Prague Castle official website, I went in with option 3. As soon as I entered, I saw Lobkowicz Palace and the Toy Museum. Traversing around the Castle District is free, but to go in certain locations you'd need to have a paid ticket available. There was a road signpost and there were buildings that look like medieval old houses-- and then of course Prague's cobblestone roads decorate the castle district roads.Walking around the district may get confusing, so I suggest getting a map, but if you don't mind getting lost, I think you wouldn't mind getting lost in a place like this! Except maybe if your feet is hurting...All in all, as long as you're not in a 1 or 2 day trip to Prague, I say that exploring this area is worth it! Oh and if you go in December, there's a Christmas market too but I forgot where exactly it was located in the castle area.

Go and see for yourself, it is so worth it.. When you visit Prague, there is no way that you will not go to see Prague castle. It is the biggest in Europe, it has so much history, you see an amazing art work. basically you feel like you are back in 15. , 16. century.

Farewell to Praha !. What a great way to explore and see the best of Prague ! You have a gentle (some steep) path wandering ever upwards or Due Up ! as a friend would quip and on the way you walk thru Squares, Restaurant Precincts, Shopping Galleries and at the top you get the stunning view back over the Town & River. Magnificent is the Word ! Castle District is a worthy way to get the most out of Prague before moving on , Little Doggies !
Great. . Just great. The whole area offers so many nice views and is just steeped in history. Definitely recommend a visit to anyone.

Step Back In Time. So glad Hitler left Prague in one piece for generations to come to enjoy. It was like stepping back in time. Lots of steps to climb or steep streets but take transport or a segue to get to the top if you can't walk the hill. The palace and museums are definitely worth taking the time to visit. The gardens are beautiful and very relaxing. Sensational historical site. Great views of the city from the top. The changing of the guard is great to see and there are concerts at the palace gates worth taking the time to listen to.
Walking tour - best. The beauty of Praha lies in its streets...Just strolling around the Vitava river is so picturesque...

Lovely area to spend a day with fantastic buildings. An area covering the palace area, beautiful palace gardens and massive gothic church. Great at night too. Less people around and very eerie if dark. Coffee and gift shops in the area too. Watch the changing of the guards. Close to Petrin hill so easy to go there and sit quietly contemplating the views once you have spent time walking around the fabulous palace area.

Must see castle. This really is a castle district rather than just a castle. The cathedral is stunning and it is lovely to just wander around the whole area. Even if you cannot afford to go into any of the buildings, the views of the city below are worth the walk.

A must see, but go early. There is lots to do here and you can see a lot without paying but my ticket to most of the sights was less than £10 so it's worth getting and then pick and choose what you want to see more of. It's well worth it just to see the row of tiny cottages the goldsmiths used to live in. It's a good climb up the hill to get here so if you need assistance in walking you may want to opt for a taxi to the top. It is touristy but the Starbucks at the entrance has some of the best views. There is plenty to do here so allow at least 2 hours minimum but if you do it all you should allow probably 3-4 hours. Try and pick a clear day, both for the walk up but also for the views

Fascinating and totally unspoilt . The whole area around the castle is a delight, with beautiful buildings and everything so well looked after. It must be even nicer in warm sunny weather! The steepish climb up to the castle area is well worth the effort.

Nice outing. It's good to walk across the river from the old town and visit the castle. There's lots of atmosphere in the streets along the river and the views from the castle grounds are worth seeing

stunning building and wonderful views. well worth walking up to the castle - we did it twice during our visit. We bought the lower priced tickets but you can see quite a lot without buying any tickets

Georgous. Check out the entire area around the castle. Get off the beaten path and pick a direction. No matter where you go, you'll be amazed at the beautiful architecture. Virtually everyone speaks english and its easy to get around.

Superb!. The castle district or Hradčany is located over a hill. This part of Prague was built much after the Nove Mesto and Mala Strana. It was an independent borough till 1784' after which it was united with the three other similar units to form a single city. Major chunk of buildings in this area belong to the castle complex. This is the largest castle complex in the world with a length of 570 meters. The Cathedral of Saint Vitus is also situated here. You can also see several palaces of the nobles here. This area was the site of a Slav settlement during the seventh century. There has been a castle here since the end of the ninth century. Ironically it has been noticed that whoever has occupied the Hrad has had political control over the Czechs. It became truly a royal town in 1598. Since then it's raison d'etre has been the castle. You can find history in every nook and cranny of this district.

A must visit in Prague. Walking up and down the castle path overlooking the old town of Prague is a must for anyone coming here. The castle is not only beautiful but a perfect historic attraction with so many memorable locations for photography and scenic views. If you are coming in winter, just be ready to get the chills here though because it is VERY windy here almost always (from the feedback I got from my friends as well) so be prepared for that :)
Very Impressive. This sight is very impressive, but crowded even when I visited in late October. The architecture is interesting and buildings well maintained. Must see when in Prague.
Prague 2016. This is a uphill walk but well worth the trip. There is so much to see I would not like to ruin what you may see.
a large citadel. fabulous but dont think this is just a castle - allow a full day as if you walk up will take a good hour .gold lane was one of my favorite parts . I would recommend a guide

Less exciting than expected . We came here with quite big expectations judging by other comments, but it just a didn't quite live up to it. The district is pretty, but the palace itself is a little bland once inside. Some areas were a little too tourist and yet contrastingly some areas where a guide would have been helpful didn't have anything at all. We did enjoy the view from by the parliament buildings though, and there is a beautifully positioned Starbucks with a view to remember. Additionally, the cathedral in the district is outstanding. We got here by the 22 tram, just make sure you are getting on going in the right direction! We didn't and ended up in the local residents areas a long way outside of the city, luckily though the trams are very regular so we easily got one back.

Great little city.. Wish we had more time on our trip to really explore inside this little city. I would say plan on spending at least a day up there as not only can you go in the castle but there are also shops and restaurants in the city walls.
Nice District. Like many other places in Prague, it's worth visiting. It won't be lost time. You should visit Castle District.

Views!. The castle district is far more than the castle, the Royal garden is a great walk and offers fantastic views of the Old Town and other parts of Prague. The Castle and St Vitus Cathedral are must sees in this district. On this trip I found the gardens most relaxing and ventured to the monastery area on my way to the explore parts of the Little Quarter to the side and below. This district can be accessed by foot (from the Little Quarter) or the trans that will drop you at the top making it a down hill walk back to Old Town Prague. I've always enjoyed this part of the city as less hectic and a great view.

a real princess castle. this is a great place to see day or night full of things to see and do eat and drink never a dull moment however take the tram up the hill then wonder down at your leisure there are many palaces to see and some stunning architecture which crys out to be taken by a camera day or night never fails to create some life long memories
Highlight of the tour. Overwhelming history of the area, well explained in several languages and with correct labelling of the exhibits - we would actually revisit this site

Half day. We spent half day there, visiting everything the ticket could take usYou will need to buy a ticket, otherwise just will see the landscapes If you have boys, don't miss the area with the armor exposition. Boys just enjoyed a lot

Interesting . A place full of fascinating history. When you arrive at the Castle district you can pay for a circuit ticket which allows you entry for many of the sites that this district has too see. It's definitely worth a ticket to get the most out of your journey put of the centre. All information is available in English and in a variety of audio guides which is great too!I wouldn't recommend this for kids though. More for interested adults. Except for the various displays of weapons there isn't too much to interest a child if I'm honest. Can get very very busy on a day with good weather!

Great day out. Missed this on first visit to Prague but glad i discovered it second time. Hradcany is a town all on its own with fantastic building and walks within its walls. There is an amazing church and graveyard at the centre which is well worth a visit. Along the top of the walls you get spectacular views of the river Vltava. Easy to get to by Metro you will need to spend at least 4 hours to enjoy all it has to offer.

Lovely walk across the bridge to the castle area. Lovely walking across the bridge to the castle area. Really nuce at Christmas time, lots of cabin stalls everywhere and lovely food cabins especially the ones sellng the famous donut with cinnamon delicious sounded like treblik. Really Christmassy around this area.
Nice vieuws. Walking around here in the castle district is very nice. Good surrondings . Old houses, old streets. Nice bars

Of course, you must visit . . .. But you may enjoy your visit more if you take Tram 22 to the Pohořelec stop, then stroll downhill. We noticed most visitors did not purchase tickets to enter the various exhibits. We did feel, however, that the ticket for St. Vitus as well as the St. Vitus Treasury were well worth the investment. We also purchased the "photo permit" for 50 Kč -- but most people were taking photos and nobody ever confirmed their permit.

Best Castle in Europe. Loved this castle. There isnt much in the way of furnishings inside but the building is amazing. You can climb 289 steps to the top of the tower for the view. Allow plenty of time for this attraction. Don't forget golden Lane. Its a street of tiny houses where the workers from the castle lived. A real step back in time.

Very touristy. I don't mean that in a bad way so much but there were a large number of souvenir shops all over. That said, plenty of places to eat and have a drink, amazing buildings and town setting. Somewhere I would certainly recommend wandering through.
Great views. It has a spectacular view but it's not yet at its full potential in my opinion. The only worth visiting is the church to be honest.
A MUST SEE!. Beautiful, bustling shopping and sightseeing area with breathtaking views of the Prague Castle and the city

Overlooking Prague - Really stunning views and a stunning place. We walked up to this district and loved the walk. It is a bit of a climb though not too much. We went through little street and steps and enjoyed this walk form the Old Town . At the top is the palace and St Vitus Cathedral. There was also an excellent street musician at the top adding atmosphere. There is a cost to visiting the palace and the cathedral but its worth it - allow plenty of time as there is a museum and some treats in store inside and you need time to enjoy. there is also a nice waiter service coffee shop with an outside terrace where you can sit and soak in the rooftops of Prague .There are regular classical concerts - we will go when we have more time as the setting is just perfect.

Best Castle iv ever seen. Prague Castle is amazing, there is so much to see up there and the views down to the city are fantastic. Not as touristy as the main square and quite peaceful later on in the day. I took a paid walking tour around the castle district which was very interesting and definitely worth attending if possible.
Stunning view of the city. Absolutely the one to visit, absolutely gorgeous and ginormous, breathtaking, beautiful eye pleasing stunning architecture
Worth crossing the bridge and exploring. Great wee streets to explore great pizza we had in fantastic wee cafe bar facing the square with a Urquell Pilsner of course when in Prague and all that
Lovely to walk around. Really nice to walk along from Loreto square - good views of the rest of Prague. Good choice of restaurants and bars all around, and lots of atmosphere at weekends.

Very pretty, amazing views too. A lovely area of the city. There is a lot of uphill walking to get to the top so make sure you are wearing your comfy shoes. When you get to the top there is an amazing panoramic view of the city; great for a group selfie too.

An entirely new sight for me.. If you are an Asian who is not used to seeing castles or buildings with Gothic designs, then this district of Prague will give you a taste of that. The way to the Prague Castle is uphill and on the way, one can see buildings with Gothic architectural designs. The streets have cobblestones so be prepared to walk uphill on such a terrain. On a snowy day, be careful as the snow can make the road slippery.

Prague is the worst. I have been dreaming about Prague for a looong time, however the trip was awful. People magnify castle zone all the time but better call "disappointment". Everything belongs to your ticket and your money, and Prague tries to deceive you. In the castle zone everything was imitation and restoration. Moreover they demand you to shop all the time. Here are the pictures that how Prague insist on you to shop and burn your money.

A lot to see. There are many different things to see in the Castle District. When you buy your tickets, plan ahead of time what all you'd like to see (just so you aren't making others wait in line while you figure it out). There are quite a few options. I can't remember which one section we chose to not do, but there was only one. We really enjoyed walking through the area and the buildings. At the very end of our visit we ended up near the dungeon, which I do recommend going down to see. It's really only about a 3-5 minute visit, but it was quite interesting (&, of course, cruel). I think we spent about 2 hours here, but could've spent another hour or so. Some people spend 5 hours here, but that would've been too much for us. There is a decent amount of walking and some stairs.

amazing. me and my girlfriend went to prague on our first trip together. an amazing city and this is one of its jewels. so much to see! but don't forget to see it using the free tour of the castle area, it makes the experience even greater!

Large Area of History - Don't Miss. This district of Prague encompasses the Castle as well as other great buildings and architecture that show out the Prague History to its very bestOne can walk everywhere here with fair ease but a lot if it is spread apart so it will keep you fit to say the least
take your camera. perfect for the history buff or just someone who likes to go on a shooting spree.....of photography that is...

Medieval reality living here. magnificent place of a great City.back to the future...I enjoyed a great orginized street hapening of King's and Queen's crowning. see my photos.Horses, actors, carriages... surprized everyone!Well preserved neighbourhood of nobels and great authors and poets.Perhaps it is the most warm experience of old times reality.

Beautiful buildings. The area around the castle is so pretty with many gorgeous buildings. You really have to look up not to miss the great architecture and paintings on the houses. There are plenty of little shops to visit and also few nice bars and restaurants.

Worth the walk. The Xastle District is certainly worth visiting if you want to see some incredibly beautiful buildings and historical monuments. Whether you are here for an afternoon or a week, this should be in your top 5 places to visit. Just bring some good walking shoes and bring a large stick to beat off the touts!

Nice to walk round. Explored this area on our recent visit to Prague. It has the usual tourist souvenir shops you see everywhere on the main roads however if you wander down the side streets you will see beautiful architecture and stumble across little restaurants and bars that are not the usual tourist haunts much better value for money and give you better quality and an insight into the real Prague. It's definitely worth spending a few hours exploring this area as it gives you a break from the hustle and bustle of the old town.
Fairytale beautiful. ABSOLUTELY THE MOST CHARMING CITY IN THE WORLD!!!! This city has all the charm of a Disney movie. Easy to access, extremely English friendly and low prices. A true gem!
Good. Hard any is situated on the hilly bank of Vltava. With the King Castle and many more historical buildings looks majestically.

Full of history. This is the must go to place in Prague...go early to try and avoid the crowds....the castle,bascillica,catherdaral etc are all here...you will need to buy a ticket to visit...well worth it...lovely cobblestone walkways and architecture and charm everywhere...nice at dusk..very atmospheric

A great day out!. St. Vitas Cathedral and the Castle dominate the skyline of Prague and is well worthy of a visit. The climb up to the Castle and Cathedral is relatively easy and it is essential to pause a while on the way up to admire the spectacular view over old Prague. The Cathedral itself is an awesome sight. Its soaring towers are majestic and its Gothic architecture is magnificent! Allow a full day to explore the Cathedral and Castle area of Prague and make sure to take advantage of the combined entry ticket to save on cost. We discovered later that the tickets are valid for two or three days so a return visit can be made if time runs out - and it inevitably will, before you complete your visit. It is possible to walk the whole area and one is constantly rewarded with amazing vistas across the city.

Like an old tale!. The Castle District is easily accessible via metro from the central train station and generally via the public transportation. There lays the old castle and a lot of parks. Remember that many of those parks (and generally most parks in Prague) are closed during winter. Anyway, in the castle area you can visit (by buying a ticket) the palace itself, the st.Vitus cathedral, the st.George Basilica, the golden lane and a lot of other stuff. There are combo tickets where you can visit a lot of things with one ticket and I think that you can buy a ticket for everything separatelly as well. If you are there, I suggest that you visit the st.Vitus cathedral and the golden lane (especially if you have small children). The palace rooms were really interesting but no big deal comparing to the cathedral. Concluding, the castle district is a beautifull place to start you journey in Prague. Remember to visit it early in the morning or late in the evening if you don't like crowdy visits. Also at 12.00 (I think) the guards are being replaced during a big ceremony which is worth watching.

Like being in a fairytale. The architecture in this part of the city is really fantastical. Narrow cobblestoned pathways wending up the hill to the castle, with shops on either side crowded about selling Czech cuisine to souvenirs. Lots of tourists obviously, but also a place where it seems, from a casual observation, like the locals actually live and thrive. (some tourist places I've seen are really just for tourists, and where locals just work). The castle grounds are quite large; I didn't bother with going into any of the buildings, but you get a good view of Prague at the top of the hill. The Cathedral on the Castle grounds is also truly magnificent.Also caught what I guess is the 'changing of the guard' ceremony at the castle gate.Walking up the hill is a bit tiring as the incline is quite steep, so good shoes are really helpful.

Nice walk up the stairs.... This is another thing to see in a most beautiful city.We took the backroad up to the castle,a lot of stairs!!!Coming down was easier.We walked through the cathedral and a bit through the castle.The changing of the guards is also a sight to see!
prague castle. it is very complete. I think the price is good. You can choose the places to enter and every building is amazing
Great History. This city is great full of life with very nice people. I recomend visiting all of it. Bring confortable shoes.
lots to see. Visit St Vitus Cathedral, amazing architecture also the castle is not as expected - it doesn't look like one! Fantastic views. easy to get to by tram.

So much to see . This area is a must when in Prague there is so much to explore and the veiws are amazing. The cathedral is definitely one to visit we didn't do the gardens as it was so cold would be better in war.er weather

Awesome but jammed. The palace grounds are truly an awesome experience, but also very very crowded. Suggest you come early and hit your hot spots before everyone shows up. The church is inspiring as are the grounds and museums.

Worth the Trek Uphill to be Amazed. It is a wonderful trek to make it to Castle District on foot from the Astronomical Clock if you can walk. At leisure and window shopping it is a wonderful 45 minute walk. If you are more determined you can make it in 30 minutes, but the entire way is worth seeing. You take Charles Street which is winding and filled with interesting shops all the way to Charles Bridge, which is beautiful and worth crossing on foot as it is completely pedestrian and filled with artists and artisans' fares to offer, then you commence the uphill trek to the Castle District. During the way up, which can be tiring for someone handicapped or elderly or simply out of shape, you can stop and rest in one of the many cafes along the way. Also, nearing the last part of the trek you must stop and admire the view of the city from this hill. People line up along the way to take pictures of the city with the beautiful red tile roofs and many church towers and spirals. Once you reach the Castle you might be lucky enough to witness the change in guard. Cross through the courtyard and go around to see St. Vitus Cathedral which is magnificent in all Gothic Splendor with amazingly tall and delicate stained glass windows. Since we were visiting in December, there were Christmas Markets by the east facade of the Cathedral and on the way up to the Castle. A wonderful inexpensive and delicious offering of lunch options if you don't mind standing while eating or locating a bench. The visit to the Castle District is definitely a must. A note: Before you begin your climb uphill to the Castle District after crossing the Charles Bridge, make a short detour to the left and go only a few blocks to visit the Church of The Baby Jesus of Prague (Or the Prague Child). It is quite famous and many devout people follow it and well worth the visit. When we visited, there were adorable donkeys, miniature horses, goats and sheep in a makeshift stable in front of the Church's steps.

Total beauty. The view of the castle from the river bank is absolutely stunning! You can see the castle from lots of spots in Prague and its always so pretty! Take some time walk along the riverbank, you can enjoy both the view and atmosphere!

Impressing Buildings, Interesting History. As the area is so close to the city, one should not leave Prague without visiting the area. For us, that had a guided tour through the area, it was a very interesing and impressing place to visit.
A Must see. The castle district houses one of the best museums, shops and landmarks in Prague.Also, the view of Prague at night from the Castle's enterance should not be missed :D

Big, big Castle. Definitely worth the visit. I recommend a guided tour if you like to know some cultural and historical facts.. I did the Castle Prague Tour with Bianca and it was amazing.You will be amazed by some buildings and some amazing details.

Not to be missed. It keeps its magical medieval atmosphere regardless of the presence of so many tourists. Like most places in Prague, it gets more atmospherical as the sun goes down.Don't let the steep roads frighten you.
The castle at night. Lovely and grand. A must visit ! This is the view after you cross the Charles Bridge then veer right along the river.

Unmissable. There is so much to see in the castle area, you could spend a holiday there!Not so much a castle as a collection of magnificent palaces, churches, and museums along with the interesting Golden Lane. I would suggest that anyone planning to visit Prague, finds out what`s happening, looks on the internet, and reads the reviews before going there - you will get far more out of a visit by doing this first.Look for a café just off George`s Lane behind St Georges Basilica (up some steps through an archway - probably selling mulled wine outside) - they do great cakes and drinks!
It's a great area!. When visiting the castle you will enjoy the whole scenic! The whole castle district is magnificent!!

Castle Visit. Highly recommend visiting the castle. I would inquire about guided tours and in the least they have recorded ones i think you can rent. As no one told us about this we kind of aimlessly wondered through the complex. While it was still fun and impressive, I think we would have gotten more out of it with a guide or in the least a guided tour. So make sure you ask when you get your tickets because they do not volunteer any info about these options.
Super!. A lot to discover in a historical way. The Castle is fantastic to have a look at even if you do not have so much interest in architeture.

Another truly beautiful part of Prague.. I don't agree with some people saying the district is boring. It has a lot going on, its lively and has a good selection of restaurants and shops to visit. What more could you want? Stunning architecture? Tick ! You have that too ! If you're in Prague you have to visit this area.
lovely castle district. The place is awesome and beautiful, worth a trip when in Prag. I would recommend a trip to the castle.

Put you're comfy shoes on!. Steep walk up to the castle, but a lovely district to discover, lots to see and plenty of places to eat. Lots of walking so comfy shoes are essential, fabulous views over Prague.

Nice to look at, less inside.. Great and very good to look at (impossible to not see in Prague) However the district itself might be a bit dissapointing. It's mainly made out of buildings inside the 'castle'. Most of it free however and it gives some very nice outlooks on the other side of the river and the old center. Would definitly go there.

By far the best district in Prague. Charles bridge, prague's castle, st. Vitus cathedral, many bistros and restaurants and a lot of architecture to admire. Castle district is simply the most significative part of Prague you may want to visit whenever you are in the city; i have been there so many times but i always find something new to discover or a new bistro to have a coffee at. Even if it gets super crowded, try to come at sunset, you will take magnificent pictures of the entire city!

Go with a guide. I would suggest you join a guided tour when you go to the castle district. They can tell you so much that you would otherwise not notice. I paid about 12 euros for a 3 hour tour (includes tram ticket).

Suitable for kids also. I was afraid to visit this with my child but I was wrong... If you bring a child carrier everything is fine... and there is also a mirror labyrinth and a park where the kids can play. They will also enjoy the tales about kings and queens. One thing is sure: the guards changing ceremony is a must for any child.

One of the top places to visit in Prague. Lot's of walking, steep hills. Would suggest public transportation to top of the district, then walking down to the Castle. Plan a full day as we did not have time to go through all the buildings. Take time to walk near the Starbucks for a great view of the city.

One full day (at least). One of the best places in Prague to walk through and relax. Just go through the area and get a real feel for history. Including the castle, you can easily spend a day or two there.
Lovely part of Prague. It's uphill so for those not so sturdy on your feet, grab a cab up there. Lot's to do and see and a really nice atmosphere. Fab Views. Enjoy!

Interesting area to visit. Use tram 22 to get there,go early and do either an organised tour or do route A with a handset commentary. We visited on Boxing Day in warm weather and brilliant blue skies and the views were amazing.Take time out to see the changing of the guard at midday. One tip is do the cathedral early because the queues get longer as the day goes on. A long and tiring tour but very interesting.

Place you can explore on your own without seeing crowds. This is my favourite part of Prague - small narrow streets lined with even smaller houses, Loreta with it´s bells, Pohořelec square with the passage to the Strahov monatery. There is a nice playground for children suitable not only for them but also for adults, since you can sit down there and relax. You can also enter the gardens from there - the entrance is hard to find but once you find it you are in the quiet part of the castle gardens. Nice in any part of the day or year.
Nice walk and great sights!. I walk through the winding streets to get to the castle and it was really nice and relaxing. There's many stores along the way as well as restaurants.
Fascinating and will take a good part of the day.. We spend 2 separate half days seeing the castle, its museums and spending time at the quaint christmas markets here.

The Castle and beyond. The Castle is beautiful and at night looks extra special. You can get to this area by walking up Nerudova Street the old Royal way or go via tram and approach it from the rear. Nerudova Street is steep so if you get breathless or are mobility challenged Id use the other way. The area is beautiful and you can get there using tram 22. Walking back is easier as its downhill and only about 20 minutes walk to the Charles bridge. The architecture is beautiful and depending on which way you walk there are some cute cosy restaurants, mostly touristy ones but if you look hard enough you will find some gems. Im not telling you which one is my favourite as I dont want it ruined with tourists but it is in this area :) Ive often stayed in the Golden Wheel Hotel and from the rooms at the back of the hotel you can get a fantastic view of the Castle.

beautiful. beautiful here and very pretty with a few markets set up for xmas, lovely to wander around with warm mulled wine while admiring the architecture of the buildings the grounds and the views of prague
This district is mesmerising. A nice uphill walk to reach the castle from charles bridge.. also pass a lot of unique shops, restaurants and cafes. and the famous church's
Xmas in Prague. We walked up to the castle area which is a bit of climb but worth it for the views.We took the tram back down, it was easier!We saw the changing of the guard at noon which was good.

Nice architecture. Nice to walk around in the castle district, coming from the Charles Bridge and uphill to castle and returning down northern walk. Great variety of buildings, castle, church, president residence and more. Fantastic view of the entire city and the "snake" river. In older days the power of the country.

Large and lots to see. Important historical monument,
huge area. It is difficult to buy tickets, it is so crowded. Architecture and palaces are wonderful. The only minus is commercialism on everywhere... shops selling the sama things.
Fabulous resturants. Fabulous restaurants overlooking Charles Bridge, worth a visit when walking back down from Prague Castle.

Beautiful district with nice views over Prague. Prague Castle and its gardens are a real gem to visit, but the rest of the district as well. Great views over Prague, old style streets, beautiful architecture and nice squares where you can buy street food. Absolutely worth a visit.
The entire district is very nice!!!. We walked up and down the hill, and it was very nice!!! Beautiful buildings, many stores and restaurants.
Worth the visit. We had a free guide of the Castle through the hop on hop off bus tour. Guide was called Lucie & she was great, and spoke excellent English having lived there for 10 years.

A great point from which to look over Prague. While Prague Castle is a must see destination for visitors to the city, the surrounding area contains much of imterest. There are also areas within the castle that do not seem to have separate entries on Trip Advisor. In particular I recommend a visit to the Powder Tower which is home to the Palace Guard Museum. Well worth visiting.

Grand part of the city. Having arranged to go on a city tour with a Segway we started in the Lesser Town and went to the castle area first which was very interesting. We could sense a slight differing style of layout and building features. The early way to show who lived or used a building was to have engravings or signs outside near the main door way so people would know where to find someone of a certain profession. This area is quite hilly in contrast to the Old and new town areas. But well worth spending time in.

So much to see. A Prague must-do. So much to see, beautiful buildings, stunning views over the city. Watch the changing of the guards, wander the narrow alley that is Golden Lane. Admire the variety of architecture, and dish up centuries of history.

Interesting area to visit, the wineries on the hills offer great view of the city. Aside of the traditional landmarks you'll see on the advertising brochures, there are a few small wineries on the hills that offer a great view of the city. Also, please note that you have to pay to walk on the Gold street. We chose not to.

Great place you must see in Prague. If you miss this place you can not say "I visited Prague"... Castle district and expecially Prague Castle is the magic place of Prague already from 13th century, where you can see small and narrow streets, historical buldings and you can feel the atmosphere from old times. Any time you come - any time you can see this magic place by different views - early in the morning, when just birds sing their songs, late in the evening when you can see all beautiful colors of lights, or in very deep night, when you can enjoy this part of Prague in its mystery.

A lovely day trip. The castle district was like a trip back in time. We spent several hours wondering around, looking at the amazing buildings and learning about their history. We also saw the changing of the guards which was a fun experience. Would highly recommend going here.

Amazing view. The view is very amazing in the castle district with all the historical buildings as well as the souvenir shops and restaurants/cafes. Make sure to bring your camera. If you are interested in garnets, this is a place that you should check out. Also, do not forget to taste trdelnik in Creperie U Kajetana, especially the one eith cinnamon and walnuts. It is very famous sweetie of Prague!
Views and shops. Walked around area enjoying scenery and history. Several nice shoos for gifts and souvenirs. I enjoyed freshly made lemonade. Great view of Parliament from this side of river.

Worth seeing the changing of the guard. We walked over Charles Bridge and browsed through the shops and walked all the way up to Prague Castle. It's a very nice walk and there's plenty to see and lots of eateries on your way up. We were lucky enough to see the changing of the guard which was well worth the climb. The views looking down from the top are absolutely magnificent. The whole district is very impressive and not to be missed.

Magical Place. What a stunning place, the walk over the bridge to see the castle and the old town is like walking back in time. The road is steep with lots of cafes, shops etc. We didn't actually go in the castle. Just happy looking around. We didi go into St Nicolas Church and that too is beautiful.
Nice to Explore. Try not to miss this part of town with lots of shops, souvenir places, restaurants and interesting sights. Best to just go and take your time and wander. Recommend.
Must See, to reach St.Vitus church. its a long walk up the hill but it is worth it :)you will find small shops along the way for food and drinklike it alot :)

One of the best in Europe. We spent a full day wandering around the castle and gardens and could really have come back for a second day - the castle is simply one of the best in europe by day or night the views are incredible a photographers dream. Pay extra to visit the various attractions if you are interested but most people will fidn something to do here - quite a steep walk up or take the mini train f you are not feeling energetic

Wonderful sites! Long walk!. The castle is great to see, but if it is your first time a tour guide would be nice, and if you don't feel like walking several miles I would suggest taking public transportation or a City Bus Tour up there.

Spectacular!!. This was one of the many highlights of our weekend trip to Prague. The weather was perfect making it even better. The views all around were amazing and the castle just beautiful to look at. We could have easily spent a few more hours there!
This is dreamworld of beerdrinkers. Everywhere you go in Prague, there is beer to find, everywhere is pubs and restaurants for a small price, beerdrinkers must go.

Great day out. There are lots of interesting things to see here. My favourite is the street of tiny cottages. Some are now shops but the ones that take you back in time for how various occupations lived are very good indeed. You think modern houses are small!!
The cathedral is very impressive with some stunning stained glass windows.
Well worth a visit
Simply magic!. The castle is worth the visit but very far away but browsing around the little streets and lovely small shops
